thread.title: Libor brokers ‘plotted at City charity event’
thread.title_full: Libor brokers ‘plotted at City charity event’

title: Libor brokers ‘plotted at City charity event’
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Libor brokers ‘plotted at City charity event’ Prince William participated in ICAP's annual charity day, when all revenues and commisions are donated to good causes Getty Images - FilmMagic Google+ 1 of 1 Prince William participated in ICAP's annual charity day, when all revenues and commisions are donated to good causes Getty Images - FilmMagic Harry Wilson City Editor Published at 12:01AM, October 8 2015 
City brokers plotted to rig borrowing rates even as Prince William attended a charity event where he manned phones at their firm, a court heard yesterday. 
Darrell Read, a former ICAP broker, gave a UBS trader an inside tip on another bank’s Libor rate submission hours before a 2006 event where celebrities, including the prince, gave their time for the biggest event in the City’s calendar, jurors were told. 
The court was shown an electronic message in which Mr Read asked Tom Hayes, a UBS trader, to “be kind”, as any commissions he paid if he acted on the information Subscribe now 
To see the full article you need to subscribe Subscribe
